summary: Tested PDF export bug fix for WASKITA LBS. The fix correctly uses target's specific coordinates (target.data.latitude/longitude) instead of capturing live screen view. Login flow works with admin/Paparoni83. PDF export for individual targets and case export both generate successfully with correct coordinates displayed.
passed_tests: PDF export for individual target - SUCCESS (toast: 'PDF berhasil di-download')
PDF export for case - SUCCESS (toast: 'PDF Case berhasil di-download')
Print button appears on hover over target items - VERIFIED
Clicking print on different targets works independently - VERIFIED
Code review: generateTargetPDF uses target.data.latitude/longitude - VERIFIED
Code review: drawLocationMap displays correct LAT/LNG coordinates - VERIFIED
Code review: handlePrintTarget creates deep copy to avoid mutation - VERIFIED
critical_code_review_comments: PDF export fix is correctly implemented - uses target.data.latitude and target.data.longitude
drawLocationMap function properly displays coordinates in the PDF map box
handlePrintTarget creates a deep copy of target data to prevent mutation during PDF generation
OSM tile loading may fail due to CORS but the drawn map placeholder always shows correct coordinates

context_for_next_testing_agent: PDF export bug fix verified. The fix uses drawLocationMap() which draws directly using target's lat/lng coordinates instead of html2canvas screenshot. Each PDF now uses the target's specific coordinates from target.data.latitude and target.data.longitude. Print button appears on hover over target items in sidebar. Three existing targets available for testing with different coordinates (Bogor, Bekasi, Bandung).
